subject: Football
lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, Jan. 14 (AP) — Not long from now, the Baltimore Ravens will reflect on the 2006 season and recognize that they finished with the best record in franchise history. They will remember fielding the top-ranked defense in the N.F.L. and bouncing back from a 6-10 season to earn the No. 2 seeding in the American Football Conference.
